case title: Gulab Manjhi @ Gulab Hembrom vs The State Of Jharkhand
issues: ['Section 5 in The Indian Penal Code', 'Section 4 in The Indian Penal Code', 'Section 3 in The Indian Penal Code']
all_text:
CORAM : HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE RAJESH SHANKAR 
 ------ 
 For the Petitioner : Mr. Santosh Kumar, Advocate For the State : Mr. P.K. Chatterjee, Spl. P.P. 
 -------- 
 02/04.09.2020 The present bail application is taken up today through Video conferencing. 
 Petitioner is an accused for the offences punishable underSections 147/148/149/353/307/324/326/325/431/440/302/120-Bof the Indian Penal Code,Sections 3/4/5/ of theExplosive Substances Act, Sections 10/13 of the U.A.P. Act and Section 17(1)(2) of C.L.A. Act, in connection with S.T. No.09 of 2011 arising out of Nawadih P.S. Case no. 87 of 2006 corresponding to G.R. No. 874 of 2006, pending in the court of Additional Sessions Judge-I, Bermo at Tenughat. 
 Learned counsel for the petitioner submits that bail applications of the petitioner were earlier rejected by this Court five times. By way of present bail application, the petitioner has renewed his prayer for regular bail, primarily on the ground that he is in judicial custody for about six years and the trial has not yet been concluded. 
 Learned Special P.P. appearing on behalf of the State of Jharkhand submits that though the trial is not proceeding as per the required pace, yet it is a case in which 14 police personnel were killed in barbaric manner by MCC extremists. It is further submitted that eight charge- sheeted witnesses have been examined so far and several other material witnesses are yet to be examined. If the petitioner is granted bail, there is least possibility that he will co-operate in the trial. Hence, the petitioner may not be given the privilege of regular bail. 
 Considering the facts and circumstances of the case and keeping in view that the bail applications of the petitioner have earlier been rejected by this Court five times, I see no reason to reconsider the petitioner's prayer for bail. 
 Accordingly, the prayer for bail of the above named petitioner is rejected. 
 (Rajesh Shankar, J.) Rohit

case title: Rajesh Yadav vs The State Of Jharkhand & Anr
judges name(s): (Anil Kumar Choudhary, J.), (Rupees Twenty Five Thousand)

all_text:
CORAM: HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE ANIL KUMAR CHOUDHARY 
 ------ 
 Heard the parties through video conferencing. 
 This criminal miscellaneous petition has been filed undersection 482Cr.P.C by the petitioner with a prayer for modification of the order dated 16.07.2019, passed in A.B.A. No. 3020 of 2019 by which the petitioner was given the privilege of anticipatory bail on satisfying the learned court below that the petitioner has taken the opposite party no.2 to his house and is keeping and maintaining her with full dignity and honour as his lawful wife. 
 Learned counsel for the petitioner submits that the petitioner will send Rs.5000/- by money order to the opposite party no.2 on any day on or before 11.09.2020. 
 It is agreed to between the parties that both the petitioner and the opposite party no.2 will appear in the trial court on 18.09.2020 and on that date, the petitioner will submit an undertaking before the trial court that he will keep and maintain the opposite party no.2 with full dignity and honour as his lawful wife and upon such undertaking submitted by the petitioner, the opposite party no.2 will go to the house of the petitioner and will reside there. 
 Keeping in view the aforesaid settlement arrived at between the parties, the order dated 16.07.2019, passed in A.B.A. No. 3020 of 2019 is modified to the extent that if the petitioner and opposite party no.2 will both appear before the learned trial court on 18.09.2020 and the petitioner gives an undertaking that he will keep the opposite party no.2 with full dignity and honour as his lawful wife, learned trial court is directed to enlarge the petitioner on bail on furnishing bail bond of Rs. 25,000/- (Rupees Twenty Five Thousand) with two sureties of the like amount each to the satisfaction of learned S.D.J.M., Deoghar, in connection with Mohanpur P.S. Case No.215 of 2018 with the condition that the petitioner will keep and maintain the opposite party no.2 with full dignity and honour as his lawful wife. 
 This criminal miscellaneous petition is disposed of accordingly. 
 (Anil Kumar Choudhary, J.) Sonu-Gunjan/

case title: Rakesh Ramdas vs The State Of Jharkhand & Another
all_text:
CORAM: HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE RONGON MUKHOPADHYAY Through Video Conferencing 
 --- 
 For the Petitioner : Mr. Manoj Kr. Sah, Advocate For the State : Mr. Vinit Kr. Vashistha, A.P.P. 
 --- 
 Order No. 02 Dated 04th September, 2020 Heard the learned counsel for the respective sides. So far as the defect No. 9(iv) is concerned, learned counsel for the petitioner undertakes to remove the same once the situation normalizes. As regards the rest defects, as pointed out by the office, are concerned, the same are ignored. 
 The petitioner apprehends his arrest in connection with Complaint P.S. Case No. 14 of 2014 (T.R. No. 19 of 2020). 
 The marriage of the daughter of the complainant was solemnized with the petitioner on 23.05.2010. It has been alleged that there was a demand of Rs. 25,000/- and on 13.09.2013, the daughter of complainant became serious ill and ultimately died in the hospital. 
 It appears that earlier a case was instituted against the petitioner u/s 304BI.P.C. being Pathargama P.S. Case No. 136 of 2013. On conclusion of investigation, final form was submitted showing it to be a mistake of facts and on a protest petition having been filed by the complainant, cognizance was taken for the offence punishable u/s 304BI.P.C. The cause of death according to the postmortem report has been opined to be antemortem haemorrhage and shock. It is to be noted herein that at the time of the death, the deceased was carrying a pregnancy of eight and half months and complications arising out of such pregnancy leading to the death of the deceased cannot be ruled out. 
 In the circumstances, noted above, therefore, I am inclined to extend the privilege of anticipatory bail to the petitioner. The petitioner accordingly is directed to surrender before the learned court below2.within four weeks from today and on such surrender, he shall be released on bail on furnishing bail bond of Rs. 10,000/- (Ten Thousand) with two sureties of the like amount each to the satisfaction of learned Sub Divisional Judicial Magistrate, Godda in connection with Complaint P.S. Case No. 14 of 2014 (T.R. No. 19 of 2020), subject to the conditions as laid down underSection 438(2)of the Code of Criminal Procedure. 
 This application stands allowed. 
 (RONGON MUKHOPADHYAY,J.) MK

issues: ['Section 482 in The Code Of Criminal Procedure, 1973']
all_text:
Heard the parties through Video Conferencing. 
 Learned counsel for the petitioner personally undertakes to remove the defects pointed out by the Stamp Reporter within two weeks after the lockdown is over. 
 In view of the personal undertaking given by learned counsel for the petitioner, the defects pointed out by the Stamp Reporter are ignored for the present. 
 This criminal miscellaneous petition has been filed undersection 482Cr.P.C by the petitioner for restoration of ABA No. 8972 of 2019. 
 Learned counsel for the petitioner submits that the ABA No. 8972 of 2019 was dismissed for non-compliance of the peremptory order dated 13.01.2020 by which the petitioner of the said ABA No. 8972 of 2019 was directed to file the proof of deposit of cost of Rs. 1,000/- with the Jharkhand Sate Legal Services Authority but because of COVID-19 pandemic, the petitioner could not deposit the cost of Rs. 1,000/-. In the meanwhile, the petitioner has deposited the said cost Rs. 1,000/- with the Jharkhand Sate Legal Services Authority and the copy of the proof has been kept at page 42 of the brief. It is then submitted by learned counsel for the petitioner that the petitioner has very good grounds to agitate in the anticipatory bail application and unless the same is restored to its original file, the petitioner will be highly prejudiced. Hence, it is submitted the ABA No. 8972 of 2019 be restored to its original file. 
 Learned Addl. P.P. has no serious objection for the prayer of restoration of anticipatory bail application. 
 Considering the aforesaid submission of the learned counsel for the petitioner, ABA No. 8972 of 2019 is restored to its original file. 
 List A.B.A. No. ABA No. 8972 of 2019 after a week before an appropriate Bench. 
 Accordingly, this criminal miscellaneous petition is disposed of. 
 (ANIL KUMAR CHOUDHARY, J.) Smita/-

case title: Anjan Banerjee vs The State Of Jharkhand
all_text:
CORAM: HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE RONGON MUKHOPADHYAY Through Video Conferencing 
 --- 
 Heard the learned counsel for the respective sides. The defects, as pointed out by the office, are ignored. The petitioner apprehends his arrest in connection with Kadma P.S. Case No. 227 of 2019. 
 It has been alleged that the informant had given Rs. 10 Lakhs to the accused persons for completion of a movie. Agreements were also entered into to the effect that the complainant would be returned Rs. 10 Lakhs along with 15% interest. The amount however was never returned. 
 It has been stated by learned counsel for the petitioner that the petitioner along with another accused are the absolute owners of Bengali Talkies Pictures. He has submitted that the petitioner has directed several Bengali movies. He further submits that the petitioner is a member of Eastern India Motion Pictures Directors Association. Mr. Sah further submits that the finances for the film was arranged by Ashok Barua and in fact 90% of the shooting is almost complete. 
 Learned APP has opposed the prayer for anticipatory bail of the petitioner. The gamut of allegations levelled against the petitioner appears to be centered around the breach of the terms and conditions of the agreement which at best would invite civil consequences. 
 On such consideration, therefore, I am inclined to extend the privilege of anticipatory bail to the petitioner. The petitioner accordingly is directed to surrender before the learned court below within four weeks from today and on such surrender, he shall be released on bail on furnishing bail bond of Rs. 10,000/- (Ten Thousand) with two sureties of the like amount each to the satisfaction of learned Sub Divisional Judicial Magistrate, Jamshedpur in connection with Kadma P.S. Case No. 227 of 2019, subject to the conditions as laid down underSection 438(2)of the Code of Criminal Procedure. 
 This application stands allowed. 
 (RONGON MUKHOPADHYAY,J.) MK

case title: Himanshu Shekhar Prasad vs State Of Jharkhand
issues: ['Section 420 in The Indian Penal Code', 'Section 419 in The Indian Penal Code', 'Section 411 in The Indian Penal Code', 'Section 409 in The Indian Penal Code', 'Section 379 in The Indian Penal Code']
all_text:
CORAM : HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE ANANDA SEN. 
 THROUGH : VIDEO CONFERENCING 
 ------ 
 FOR THE PETITIONER(S) : Mr. Rishi Pallava, Advocate FOR THE STATE : Mr. Sanjay Kr. Pandey, APP 
 ------ 
 06/04.09.2020 I.A. No.3517 of 2020 Heard learned counsel for the parties through video conferencing. They have no complain with respect to the audio and video clarity and quality. 
 The petitioner is convicted for committing an offence punishable underSections 467,468,471,379,409,411,419,420IPC. 
 Earlier the prayer for bail of the petitioner was rejected. This criminal revision application has already been admitted for hearing. Petitioner was at liberty to renew his prayer after serving half of the sentence. Now petitioner has renewed his prayer on the ground that he has served half of the sentence. He is in custody for more than twenty months out of three years. 
 Considering the submission of the petitioner, I am inclined to allow this application. Accordingly, the petitioner above named is directed to be released on bail on furnishing bail bond of Rs. 10,000/- (Rupees Ten Thousand) with two sureties of the like amount each to the satisfaction of learned Judicial Magistrate, 1st Class, Giridih in connection with G.R. No. 87 of 1993 (T.R. No. 172 of 2012) subject to the condition that petitioner will mark his attendance before the Judge- in-charge, civil court, Giridih once in three months. 
 I direct the Jail Authority that before releasing the petitioner from Jail, the Jail Authority should get the petitioner tested for Covid-19. If the report is positive, then the District Administration will immediately take steps to isolate the petitioner and get him treated in the COVID Centre by following all the protocols. 
 This direction is given in the larger public interest and it should not be construed as a condition of bail. 
 Accordingly, interlocutory application stands allowed. 
 (ANANDA SEN , J) anjali/ C.P 3

case title: Kisun Hansda vs The State Of Jharkhand
issues: ['Section 420 in The Indian Penal Code']
all_text:
CORAM: HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE RONGON MUKHOPADHYAY 
 -------- 
 Heard learned counsel for the petitioner and learned counsel appearing for the State. 
 Defect no. 9(i), as pointed out by the office, is ignored. The petitioner apprehends his arrest in connection with Gamharia P.S. Case No. 29 of 2020, registered for the offences punishable undersections 420of the Indian Penal Code and u/s 7 ofEssential Commodities Act. 
 The petitioner is a PDS dealer and it has been alleged that some of the villagers had complained regarding the petitioner giving less food grains. 
 It has been stated that even during the pandemic ration has been appropriately distributed as per the entitlement of the beneficiaries. Learned counsel also referred to the representation submitted by the petitioner which was signed by a majority of the beneficiaries. Learned counsel for the petitioner submits that the petitioner is a PDS dealer since 2006 and there has been no complaint made anywhere regarding the distribution of food grains carried out by the petitioner. 
 Learned A.P.P. has opposed the prayer anticipatory bail of the petitioner. On consideration of the aforesaid facts especially with respect to the fact that no complaints have ever been received against the petitioner prior to institution of the present case, I am inclined to extend the privilege of anticipatory bail to the petitioner. Accordingly, the petitioner, above named, is directed to surrender in the court below within a period of four weeks from today and pray for regular bail, and in that event, he will be enlarged on bail, on furnishing bail bond of Rs. 10,000/- (Ten Thousand only) with two sureties of the like amount each to the satisfaction of learned Chief Judicial Magistrate, Seraikella, in connection with Gamharia P.S. Case No. 29 of 2020, subject to the conditions as laid down undersection 438(2)of the Code of Criminal Procedure. 
 This application stands allowed. 
 (Rongon Mukhopadhyay, J.) MM

case title: Raja Munda vs The State Of Jharkhand
all_text:
CORAM: HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE RONGON MUKHOPADHYAY Through Video Conferencing 
 --- 
 For the Petitioner : Mr. Alok Lal, Advocate For the State : Mr. Bhola Nath Ojha, A.P.P.

 --- 
 Order No. 02 Dated 04th September, 2020 Heard the learned counsel for the respective sides. The defects, as pointed out by the office, are ignored. The petitioner apprehends his arrest in connection with Lalpur P.S. Case No. 339 of 2019. 
 It has been alleged that the petitioner and others were forcibly trying to take possession of the land of the informant. They were acting at the behest of Ramesh Oraon. The petitioner claims to be having right, title and possession of the land in question. 
 Mr. Rakesh Kr. Sinha, learned counsel for the informant has stated that the accused persons have lost up to this Court and in fact the petitioner is making efforts to evict the informant and his family members from the land in question. 
 The petitioner has referred to a plethora of cases concerning the said land and it appears that a suit has also been filed which is still pending. 
 The allegations are centered around Ramesh Oraon and the petitioner has been depicted to be one of the henchmen of Ramesh Oraon. 
 On consideration of the aforesaid facts, I am inclined to extend the privilege of anticipatory bail to the petitioner. The petitioner accordingly is directed to surrender before the learned court below within four weeks from today and on such surrender, he shall be released on bail on furnishing bail bond of Rs. 10,000/- (Ten Thousand) with two sureties of the like amount each to the satisfaction of learned Judicial Magistrate, 1st Class, Ranchi in connection with Lalpur P.S. Case No. 339 of 2019, subject to the conditions as laid down underSection 438(2)of the Code of Criminal Procedure. 
 This application stands allowed. 
 (RONGON MUKHOPADHYAY,J.) MK

judges name(s): (Rongon Mukhopadhyay, J.), (Ten Thousand only), (S), (G.R. No. 738 of 2019), (2)
issues: ['Section 461 in The Indian Penal Code', 'Section 379 in The Indian Penal Code']
all_text:
CORAM: HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE RONGON MUKHOPADHYAY 
 -------- 
 Heard learned counsel for the petitioner and learned counsel appearing for the State. 
 So far as defect nos. 9(ii) and 9(iii) are concerned, learned counsel for the petitioner undertakes to remove the same once the situation normalizes. As regards rest defects are concerned, the same are ignored. 
 The petitioner apprehend his arrest in connection with R.I.T. P.S. Case No. 126 of 2019 (S) (G.R. No. 738 of 2019), registered for the offences punishable undersections 379/461of the Indian Penal Code. 
 The factory of the informant was closed during Durga Puja. It was alleged that when it reopened some materials were found stolen and from the C.C.Tv. footage one of the workers was seen in the night of 05.10.2019. The petitioner seems to have been implicated on the confession of the co-accused Paltan Hembrom. 
 On consideration of the facts that the petitioner has been implicated only on account of the confession of the co-accused and there being no other materials to suggest the complicity of the petitioner, I am inclined to extend the privilege of anticipatory bail to the petitioner. Accordingly, the petitioner, above named, is directed to surrender in the court below within a period of four weeks from today and pray for regular bail, and in that event, he will be enlarged on bail, on furnishing bail bond of Rs. 10,000/- (Ten Thousand only) with two sureties of the like amount each to the satisfaction of learned Chief Judicial Magistrate, Seraikella, in connection with R.I.T. P.S. Case No. 126 of 2019 (S) (G.R. No. 738 of 2019), subject to the conditions as laid down undersection 438(2)of the Code of Criminal Procedure. 
 This application stands allowed. 
 (Rongon Mukhopadhyay, J.) MM

case title: Md. Irshad vs The State Of Jharkhand
issues: ['Section 376 in The Indian Penal Code', 'Section 366 in The Code Of Criminal Procedure, 1973', 'Section 34 in The Indian Penal Code', 'Section 379 in The Code Of Criminal Procedure, 1973']
all_text:
CORAM: HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE AMITAV K. GUPTA HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE RAJESH KUMAR 
 --------- 
 For the Appellant : Mr. Vijay Kumar Roy, Advocate For the State : Mr. Sanat Kumar Jha, A.P.P 
 --------- 
 06/Dated: 04th September, 2020 
 1. Office to delete the name of Mr. Suraj Mohan and mention the name of Mr. Sanat Kumar Jha, as the counsel for the State, in the daily cause list. 
 I.A. No.11415 of 2019 
 1. This interlocutory application has been filed underSection 389(1)of the Code of Criminal Procedure for suspension of the sentence and grant of ad-interim bail, to the petitioner, during the pendency of the appeal. 
 2. The petitioner/ appellant has been convicted for the offence underSections 366,366(A),379read withSection 34and376of the Indian Penal Code and sentenced to undergo R.I of 10 years and to pay a fine of Rs.10,000/-, in default thereof, to further undergo S.I of two months for the offence underSection 376I.P.C, in Sessions Trial No.03 of 2012. 
 3. Having heard learned counsel for the appellant and learned A.P.P and on perusal of the materials on record, it transpires that the petitioner has remained in jail custody from 19.09.2011 to 05.11.2014 and after conviction he is in jail custody since 13.09.2018. 
 Considering that the appellant has completed half of the sentence, we are inclined to suspend the sentence and enlarge the appellant on bail, during the pendency of the appeal, on his furnishing bail bond of Rs.10,000/- (Rupees Ten Thousand) with two sureties of the like amount each to the satisfaction of learned Additional Sessions Judge - I,-2-Giridih, in connection with S.T. No.03 of 2012, subject to the condition that the appellant shall deposit the fine amount of Rs.10,000/- (Ten thousand) in the court below. 
 4. The appellant shall remain present before the Court when the appeal is taken up for hearing, failing which his bail shall be cancelled. 
 5. I.A. No.11415 of 2019 stands allowed. 
 (Amitav K. Gupta, J.) (Rajesh Kumar, J.) Chandan/-

case title: Ram Bilesh Das @ Ram Bilash Das vs The State Of Jharkhand
all_text:
CORAM: HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE RONGON MUKHOPADHYAY Through Video Conferencing 
 --- 
 Heard the learned counsel for the respective sides. The defects, as pointed out by the office, are ignored. The petitioners apprehend their arrest in connection with Chutia P.S. Case No. 162 of 2019. 
 It has alleged that the petitioners had taken a friendly loan of about 6.25 Lakhs, but refused to return the same to the informant. 
 It appears that the daughter of the informant was married to the son of the petitioner No. 1 on 11.05.2011 and due to illness she died on 17.07.2017. The son of the petitioner No. 1 had filed a case at Family Court, Ranchi for custody of his children and the present case seems to have been filed after the guardianship case filed by the son of the petitioner No. 1. The petitioner No. 1 appears to be the father-in-law of the deceased daughter of the informant, while the petitioners No. 2 and 3 are the brothers-in-law. Moreover, the amount in question appears to have been paid prior to the marriage. 
 In view of the bitter relationship existing between the parties, as indicated above, the false implication of the petitioners also cannot be ruled. 
 In the circumstances noted above, I am inclined to extend the privilege of anticipatory bail to the petitioners. The petitioners accordingly are directed to surrender before the learned court below within four weeks from today and on such surrender, they shall be released on bail on furnishing bail bond of Rs. 10,000/- (Ten Thousand) each with two sureties of the like amount each to the satisfaction of learned Judicial Magistrate, 1st Class, Ranchi in connection with Chutia P.S. Case No. 162 of 2019, subject to the conditions as laid down underSection 438(2)of the Code of Criminal Procedure. 
 This application stands allowed. 
 (RONGON MUKHOPADHYAY,J.) MK

all_text:

 2. Santoshini Murmu

 -------

 ------- 
 02/04.09.2020 Heard Mr. Ashok Kr. Jha, learned counsel for the petitioners and Mr. S.K. Dubey, learned A.P.P. for the State. 
 Defects as pointed out by the office are ignored. The petitioners have prayed for grant of anticipatory bail, as they are apprehending their arrest in connection with Itki P.S. Case No. 68/2019. 
 It has been alleged that the elder brother of the informant had committed suicide. A suicide note was recovered which disclosed about the depression suffered by the deceased. 
 It appears that the petitioners are the in-laws of the deceased who have been alleged to have instigated him to commit suicide. In fact the wife of the deceased namely Manisha Tudu whose act of elopement after the solemnization of the marriage with the deceased purportedly leading the deceased to commit suicide has already been granted anticipatory bail by this Court in A.B.A. No. 2477 of 2020. 
 On consideration of the fact that the main accused Manisha Tudu has been granted anticipatory bail by this Court, I am inclined to extend the privilege of anticipatory bail to the petitioners. The petitioners are accordingly directed to surrender before the learned court below within a period of four weeks and on such surrender, they shall be-2-released on bail on furnishing bail bond of Rs. 10,000/- (Rupees Ten Thousand only) each with two sureties of the like amount each to the satisfaction of learned Judicial Magistrate XIth at Ranchi in connection with Itki P.S. Case No. 68/2019, subject to the conditions as laid down underSection 438(2)of the Code of Criminal Procedure. 
 This application stands allowed. 
 (R. Mukhopadhyay, J.) Alok/-

case title: Kunj Bihari Ojha vs The State Of Jharkhand
all_text:
Kunj Bihari Ojha ... ... Petitioner Versus 
 1. The State of Jharkhand 
 2. Kishore Kumar O Jha ... ... Opposite Parties 
 ------- 
 CORAM : HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE RONGON MUKHOPADHYAY Through- Video Conferencing 
 ------- 
 For the Petitioner : Mr. S.S. Choudhary, Advocate For the State : Ms. Anuradha Sahay, A.P.P. 
 ------- 
 02/04.09.2020 Heard Mr. S.S. Choudhary, learned counsel for the petitioner and Ms. Anuradha Sahay, learned A.P.P. for the State. 
 Defects as pointed out by the office are ignored. The petitioner has prayed for grant of anticipatory bail, as he is apprehending his arrest in connection with Barhait Complaint Case No. 581/2018. 
 It has been alleged that the ancestral land in J.B. No. 35 of the complainant was fraudulently sold by the accused persons. 
 Learned counsel for the petitioner has referred to a report of C.O., Sahibganj from which it appears that J.B. No. 361 which is also a bone of contention between the two parties stands recorded in the name of the grand father of the petitioner. Mr. Choudhary, has further submitted that with respect to the same issue two separate writ applications were filed before this Court. 
 In fact it appears that both the complainant as well as the petitioner claims the land in question to be there own. The dispute as it appears would invite civil consequences. 
 On consideration of the aforesaid facts, I am inclined to extend the privilege of anticipatory bail to the petitioner. The petitioner accordingly is directed to surrender before the learned court below within a period of four weeks and on such surrender, he shall be released on bail on furnishing bail bond of Rs. 10,000/- (Rupees Ten Thousand only) with-2-two sureties of the like amount each to the satisfaction of learned C.J.M., Sahibganj in connection with Barhait Complaint Case No. 581/2018, subject to the conditions as laid down underSection 438(2)of the Code of Criminal Procedure. 
 This application stands allowed. 
 (R. Mukhopadhyay, J.) Alok/-

case title: Dr. Alok Ratan Choudhary vs State Of Jharkhand
issues: ['Section 204 in The Code Of Criminal Procedure, 1973', 'Section 190 in The Code Of Criminal Procedure, 1973']
all_text:
CORAM : HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE ANANDA SEN. 
 THROUGH : VIDEO CONFERENCING 
 ------ 
 FOR THE PETITIONER(S) : Mr. Jitendra Singh, Advocate FOR THE STATE : APP 
 ------ 
 05/04.09.2020 Heard learned counsel for the parties through video conferencing. They have no complain with respect to the audio and video clarity and quality. 
 Counsel for the petitioners submits that he has removed the defect(s) by filing supplementary affidavit. 
 In this application, petitioners have prayed to quash the composite order dated 8.01.2018 by which cognizance of the offence punishable underSection 498AIPC and Section ¾ ofDowry Prohibition Acthas been taken. 
 Learned counsel for the petitioners submits that the cognizance order is absolutely bad and is a non-speaking order and it does not reflect any subjective satisfaction as to what are the materials to take cognizance against these petitioners. He submits that the requirements ofSections 190&204Cr.P.C has not been dealt with in the impugned order. 
 After going through the record, I find that the court below has merely filled up the blank in the order-sheet which suggests non-application of mind. I also find that the order is absolutely cryptic and non-speaking and is not in conformity with the judgment passed by this Court in the case of Amresh Kumar Dhiraj and Ors. Vs. State of Jharkhand &Anr., reported in 2020 (1) JLJR 199. What are the materials against the petitioners to proceed, has also not been mentioned. Thus, the impugned order dated 8.01.2018 passed by the Judicial Magistrate, Jamshedpur is, hereby, set aside. The matter is remitted to the court below to pass a fresh order in accordance with the provision of law. 
 This criminal miscellaneous petition stands allowed. 
 (ANANDA SEN , J) anjali/ C.P 3

case title: Santosh Ram @ Santosh Ravidas vs The State Of Jharkhand

 ---

 --- 
 4/04.09.2020 I. A. No. 3489 of 2020: 
 The appellant no. 1 has renewed his prayer for bail during the pendency of this appeal through this interlocutory application. 
 Heard learned counsel for the parties. 
 Mr. A. K. Kashyap, learned senior counsel for the appellants has stated that no offence underSection 307I.P.C. has been made out. It has further been stated that the informant was faced with an accident and the appellants had wrongly been convicted for the offence under Section 307 I.P.C. It has further been stated that the appellant no. 1 is in custody since 14.08.2019 and had remained for more than a year out of a maximum sentence of 5 years as imposed by the learned trial court for the offence under Section 307/34 I.P.C. 
 Learned counsel for the State opposes the prayer for bail. The prayer for bail of the appellant no. 1 was earlier rejected in I.A. No. 8867 of 2019 on 07.01.2020. The appellant no. 1 appears to have completed for more than a year in custody and there is no chance of the appeal being heard in the near future. 
 On such consideration, therefore, the appellant no. 1 namely, Santosh Ram @ Santosh Ravidas, during the pendency of this appeal is directed to be released on bail on furnishing bail bond of Rs. 10,000/- (Ten Thousand) with two sureties of the like amount each, to the satisfaction of the Additional Sessions Judge VIII, Dhanbad in connection with S. T. No. 62 of 2017 arising out of Barwadda P. S. Case No. 167 of 2016 corresponding to G. R. No. 4748 of 2016. 
 I.A. No. 3489 of 2020 stands disposed of. 
 (Rongon Mukhopadhyay, J) R. Shekhar Cp 3

all_text:
CORAM: HON'BLE MRS. JUSTICE ANUBHA RAWAT CHOUDHARY 
 --- 
 For the Petitioner : Mr. Shri Krishna Murari, Advocate For the Opp. Party : Mr. Ravi Prakash, A.P.P. 
 Through Video Conferencing 2/04.09.2020 
 1. Heard Mr. Shri Krishna Murari, learned counsel appearing on behalf of the petitioner. 
 2. Learned counsel for the petitioner submits that the petitioner is in custody since 08.08.2018 in connection with Latehar P.S. Case No. 124 of 2018 corresponding to N.D.P.S. Case No. 06 of 2018 registered underSections 17and18of the N.D.P.S. Act, pending in the court of learned Sessions Judge, Latehar. 
 3. Learned counsel for the petitioner submits that the bail application of the petitioner was earlier rejected by this court vide order dated 05.07.2019 in B.A. No. 1867 of 2019. The petitioner has renewed his prayer for bail on the ground of his custody. However, during the course of argument, learned counsel submits that there is no minimum sentence prescribed for the alleged offence and the sentence can be up to 15 years. 
 4. Mr. Ravi Prakash appearing on behalf of the opposite party- State opposes the prayer for bail of the petitioner. 
 5. After hearing learned counsel for the parties and considering the facts and circumstances of this case, particularly the fact that the bail application of the petitioner was earlier rejected by this court vide order dated 05.07.2019 on merits and considering the seriousness of offence, this court is not inclined to enlarge the petitioner on bail. Accordingly, prayer for bail of the petitioner is hereby rejected. 
 6. Let this order be communicated to the court concerned through FAX/e-mail. 
 (Anubha Rawat Choudhary, J.) Binit/

case title: Makbul Miyan vs The State Of Jharkhand
judges name(s): (Rongon Mukhopadhyay, J.), (Ten Thousand only), (G.R. Case No. 167 of 2019), (2)
issues: ['Section 34 in The Indian Penal Code', 'Section 279 in The Indian Penal Code', 'Section 414 in The Indian Penal Code', 'Section 379 in The Indian Penal Code']
all_text:
CORAM: HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE RONGON MUKHOPADHYAY 
 -------- 
 Heard learned counsel for the petitioner and learned A.P.P. So far as defect no. 9(ii), as pointed out by the office is ignored, learned counsel for the petitioner submits that the said defect has been removed. Office to check and verify and if the same has not been removed learned counsel shall remove the same once the situation normalizes. So far as the rest defects, if any, are concerned, the same are ignored. 
 The petitioner apprehends his arrest in connection with Bano P.S. Case No. 20 of 2019 (G.R. Case No. 167 of 2019), registered for the offence punishable undersections 379,414,279/34of the Indian Penal Code. 
 One 407 vehicle loaded with woods met with an accident. The driver had disclosed about the persons involved in illegal transportation of woods. Suspicion has been cast upon the petitioner on account of the fact that the petitioner was in regular contact with the other accused persons. It appears that some of the co-accused persons have been granted anticipatory bail by this Court in A.B.A. No. 7325 of 2019. 
 On consideration of the aforesaid facts, I am inclined to extend the privilege of anticipatory bail to the petitioner. Accordingly, the petitioner, above named, is directed to surrender in the court below within a period of four weeks from today and pray for regular bail, and in that event, he will be enlarged on bail, on furnishing bail bond of Rs. 10,000/- (Ten Thousand only) with two sureties of the like amount each to the satisfaction of learned Judicial Magistrate, 1st Class, Simdega, in connection with Bano P.S. Case No. 20 of 2019 (G.R. Case No. 167 of 2019), subject to the conditions as laid down undersection 438(2)of the Code of Criminal Procedure. 
 This application stands allowed. 
 (Rongon Mukhopadhyay, J.) MM

which has been held through video conferencing today at 11.00 A.M. They have no complaint in respect to the audio and video clarity and quality.

all_text:
CORAM: HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE RONGON MUKHOPADHYAY Through Video Conferencing 
 --- 
 For the Petitioner : Mr. K.S. Nanda, Advocate For the State : Mrs. Anuradha Sahay, A.P.P. 
 --- 
 Order No.02 Dated 4th September, 2020 Heard the learned counsel for the respective sides. Defects, as pointed out by the office, are ignored. The petitioner apprehends his arrest in connection with Lower Bazar P.S. Case No.128 of 2019. 
 It has been alleged that the informant had purchased the land on the assurance and inducement of the accused persons. An agreement was entered into and the informant had also paid a huge amount. However, the sale deed was not executed nor the amount of Rs.14,00,000/- was returned. It appears that the First Information Report has been instituted after 5 years. It further appears from the allegations that the same basically reveals breach of the terms and conditions of the agreement which could at best invite civil consequences. 
 On consideration of the aforesaid facts, I am inclined to extend the privilege of anticipatory bail to the petitioner. The petitioner is directed to surrender before the learned court below within four weeks from today and on such surrender, he shall be released on bail on furnishing bail bond of Rs.10,000/- (Ten Thousand) with two sureties of the like amount each to the satisfaction of learned Judicial Magistrate, at Ranchi in connection with Lower Bazar P.S. Case No.128 of 2019, subject to the conditions as laid down underSection 438(2)of the Code of Criminal Procedure. 
 This application stands allowed. 
 (RONGON MUKHOPADHYAY,J.) Raja/-

 Order No. 02: Dated: 4th September, 2020 Heard learned counsel for the petitioner and learned counsel appearing for the State. 
 Defects, as pointed out by the office, are ignored. The petitioner apprehends his arrest in connection with B.S. City P.S. Case No. 27 of 2020, registered for the offences punishable undersections 341,307,604/34of the Indian Penal Code andsection 27of Arms Act. 
 It has been alleged that the petitioner and others had entered into the hotel of the informant and demanded food and wine. When the informant disclosed that he does not sell wine a quarrel had ensued and Bittu Rana and Bhim Paswan had fired at the informant who had a providential escape. It appears that the petitioner was one of the associates of the accused persons who had fired upon the informant. 
 In view of the nature of allegation leveled against the petitioner, I am not inclined to extend the privilege of anticipatory bail to the petitioner. 
 This application, accordingly, rejected. 
 (Rongon Mukhopadhyay, J.) MM

case title: Ganesh Kumar vs The State Of Jharkhand
issues: ['Section 34 in The Indian Penal Code', 'Section 409 in The Indian Penal Code']
all_text:
The petitioner is apprehending his arrest in connection with Sadar (Town) P.S. Case No. 13 of 2014 corresponding to G.R. No. 63 of 2014, for the alleged offence underSections 409/34of the Indian Penal Code. 
 The petitioner was working as an Assistant Engineer and there is allegation against him to have not accounted for the amount of about Rs. 2,32,96,080/-, which was advanced to the petitioner for the different works. 
 Earlier the prayer for anticipatory bail of this petitioner was rejected on merits, by order dated 25.9.2014, passed in A.B.A. No. 1186 of 2014. Learned counsel for the petitioner has renewed the prayer for anticipatory bail. 
 The petitioner, after rejection of his prayer for anticipatory bail in the year 2014, has not yet surrendered in the Court below and absconding since then. 
 As such, there can be no reconsideration of anticipatory bail at this belated stage and accordingly, the prayer for anticipatory bail of the petitioner Ganesh Kumar is, hereby, rejected. 
 ( H. C. Mishra, J.) Amitesh/-

case title: Aarif Ansari vs The State Of Jharkhand
all_text:
CORAM: HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE RONGON MUKHOPADHYAY Through Video Conferencing 
 --- 
 For the Petitioner : Mr. Prashant Kumar Rahul, Advocate For the State : Mr. Shekhar Sinha, A.P.P. 
 --- 
 Order No.02 Dated 4th September, 2020 Heard the learned counsel for the respective sides. So far as the defects No. 3, 4, 5(d) and (e) are concerned, learned counsel for the petitioner undertakes to remove the same once the situation normalizes. As regards rest defects are concerned, the same are ignored. 
 The petitioner apprehends his arrest in connection with Latehar P.S. Case No.26 of 2020. 
 A truck illegally loaded with coal was seized. The petitioner appears to be the driver of the seized truck bearing registration no. UP67T-6922. 
 Learned counsel for the petitioner submits that the petitioner does not have any criminal antecedent. 
 It appears that the coal was purchased from M/S Maa Vaishno Coal Depot and the invoices have been brought on record. Prima facie, therefore, it appears that the coal was being transported under a valid sanctity of law. 
 On such consideration, therefore, I am inclined to extend the privilege of anticipatory bail to the petitioner. The petitioner is directed to surrender before the learned court below within four weeks from today and on such surrender, he shall be released on bail on furnishing bail bond of Rs.10,000/- (Ten Thousand) with two sureties of the like amount each to the satisfaction of learned Chief Judicial Magistrate, Latehar in connection with Latehar P.S. Case No.26 of 2020, subject to the conditions as laid down underSection 438(2)of the Code of Criminal Procedure. 
 This application stands allowed. 
 (RONGON MUKHOPADHYAY,J.) Raja/-

case title: Rambilash Yadav vs The State Of Jharkhand
all_text:
CORAM: HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE RONGON MUKHOPADHYAY Through Video Conferencing 
 --- 
 For the Petitioners : Mr. Anjani Kumar, Advocate For the State : Mr. Prabir Chatterjee, Spl.P.P. 
 --- 
 Order No.02 Dated 4th September, 2020 Heard the learned counsel for the respective sides. Defects, as pointed out by the office, are ignored. The petitioners apprehend their arrest in connection with Chaibasa Sadar P.S. Case No.135 of 2019. 
 Two tractors were seized which were loaded with illegally extracted sand. The petitioner no.1 appears to be the owner of tractor bearing registration no.JH06K-7808 while the petitioner no.2 is the owner of the other seized tractor. 
 It has been stated by the learned counsel for the petitioners that the tractors were entrusted to the drivers and, therefore, the petitioners cannot be held responsible for any offence committed by the drivers. 
 On consideration of the fact that the petitioners are the owners of the concerned tractors which were seized while transporting illegally extracted sand, I am inclined to extend the privilege of anticipatory bail to the petitioners. The petitioners are directed to surrender before the learned court below within four weeks from today and on such surrender, they shall be released on bail on furnishing bail bond of Rs.10,000/- (Ten Thousand) each with two sureties of the like amount each to the satisfaction of learned Chief Judicial Magistrate, Chaibasa in connection with Chaibasa Sadar P.S. Case No.135 of 2019, subject to the conditions as laid down underSection 438(2)of the Code of Criminal Procedure. 
 This application stands allowed. 
 (RONGON MUKHOPADHYAY,J.) Raja/-

case title: Baldeo Sao vs The State Of Jharkhand
all_text:
CORAM: HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE RONGON MUKHOPADHYAY 
 -------- 
 Heard learned counsel for the petitioner and learned counsel appearing for the State assisted by the learned counsel for the O.P. No. 2. 
 The petitioner apprehends his arrest in connection with Koderma (Mahila) P.S. Case No. 08 of 2019, registered for the offences punishable under sections 494, 498 A, 34of the Indian Penal Code. 
 The marriage of the informant was solemnized with the petitioner ten years back. It has been alleged that when her health deteriorated she has ousted from her matrimonial house and on 18.06.2019, the petitioner had solemnized marriage with another girl. 
 It appears that there is no denial with respect to the solemnization of the second marriage by the petitioner. It further appears from the impugned order that the witnesses have supported the allegations including that of the petitioner solemnizing the second marriage. 
 In view of the aforesaid facts, I am not inclined to extend the privilege of anticipatory bail to the petitioner. 
 This application, accordingly, stands rejected. However, if the petitioner surrenders before the learned court below within a period of three weeks and prays for bail, the learned court below shall endeavor to dispose of the bail application expeditiously without being prejudiced by this order. 
 (Rongon Mukhopadhyay, J.) MM

case title: Vivek Kumar Sahu @ Vivek Kumar vs The State Of Jharkhand
issues: ['Section 506 in The Indian Penal Code', 'Section 323 in The Indian Penal Code', 'Section 313 in The Indian Penal Code', 'Section 376 in The Indian Penal Code']
all_text:
CORAM: HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE RONGON MUKHOPADHYAY 
 -------- 
 Heard learned counsel for the petitioner and learned counsel appearing for the State. 
 Defect no. 9(i), as pointed out by the office, is ignored. The petitioner apprehends his arrest in connection with Ghaghra P.S. Case No. 1 of 2020, registered for the offences punishable undersections 376,313,323,506of the Indian Penal Code. 
 It has been alleged that the petitioner had established physical relationship with the informant on the pretext of marriage. Her pregnancy was also terminated by administering medicines. In spite of repeated assurances, the petitioner ultimately did not solemnize marriage with the informant. 
 The informant appears to be a major lady and consented to the sexual overtures made by the petitioner. In fact the relationship, as it appears, continued for three years. 
 On consideration to the aforesaid facts, I am inclined to extend the privilege of anticipatory bail to the petitioner. Accordingly, the petitioner, above named, is directed to surrender in the court below within a period of four weeks from today and pray for regular bail, and in that event, he will be enlarged on bail, on furnishing bail bond of Rs. 10,000/- (Ten Thousand only) with two sureties of the like amount each to the satisfaction of learned Sub- Divisional Judicial Magistrate, Gumla, in connection with Ghaghra P.S. Case No. 1 of 2020, subject to the conditions as laid down undersection 438(2)of the Code of Criminal Procedure. 
 This application stands allowed. 
 (Rongon Mukhopadhyay, J.) MM

case title: Sunita Devi vs The State Of Jharkhand
all_text:
Coram: THE HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE RONGON MUKHOPADHYAY 
 -------- 
 Defects, as pointed out by the office, are ignored. The petitioner apprehends her arrest in connection with Manika P.S. Case No. 92 of 2018. 
 It has been alleged that the Dobha was excavated through JCB Machine, which was contrary to the objects of MANREGA. ` Petitioner appears to be the beneficiary of the scheme and the entire allegation is concentrated around the agents who instead of engaging manpower had constructed the Dobha by using JCB Machine. Similarly situated beneficiary namely Ramnandan Yadav has been granted anticipatory bail by this Court in A.B.A. No. 1506 of 2020. 
 On consideration of the entire facts, I am inclined to extend the privilege of anticipatory bail to the petitioner. 
 Accordingly, the petitioner, named above, is directed to surrender in the court below within a period of four weeks from today and pray for regular bail, and in that event, she will be enlarged on bail, on furnishing bail bond of Rs.10,000/- ( Ten thousand only) with two sureties of the like amount each to the satisfaction of learned Additional Chief Judicial Magistrate, Latehar in connection with Manika P.S. Case No. 92 of 2018, subject to the conditions as laid down underSection 438(2)of the Code of Criminal Procedure. 
 This application stands allowed. 
 (Rongon Mukhopadhyay, J) Rakesh/-

 It has been alleged that the petitioner and the informant had developed acquaintance through facebook and whatsapp. On 08.06.2017, the petitioner had established physical relationship with the informant on the pretext of marriage. 
 It appears from the information gathered through RTI that the date of birth of the informant is 12.06.1997 which would mean that the informant was a major at the time when the incident had occurred. all_text:
