 4.Mahesh Kumar Ray @ Mahesh Ray ... Petitioners Versus The State of Jharkhand ... Opposite Party 
 ------ 
 CORAM: HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE ANIL KUMAR CHOUDHARY 
 ------ 
 Heard the parties through video conferencing. Learned counsel for the petitioners personally undertakes to remove the defects as pointed out by the stamp reporter within two weeks after the lockdown period is over. 
 In view of the personal undertaking of the learned counsel for the petitioners, the defects pointed out by the stamp reporter are ignored for the present. 
 Apprehending their arrest, the petitioners have moved this Court for grant of privilege of anticipatory bail in connection with Dhanwar P.S. Case No.61 of 2019 registered undersections 147/148/149/323/324/307/504/506of the Indian Penal Code. 
 The Learned counsel for the petitioners submits that the allegation against the petitioners is that the petitioners were member of an unlawful assembly and being armed with deadly weapons attempted to murder the Sudhir Bhokta, Nageshwar Bhokta, Madan Kumar Ray, Manoj Ray, Kapil Bhokta. It is further submitted that the allegation against the petitioners are all false and for the selfsame occurrence, from the side of the petitioners, an FIR was lodged basing upon which Dhanwar P.S. Case No.61 of 2019 has been registered. It is next submitted that there was free fight between the parties. It is then submitted that the petitioners are ready and willing to jointly pay Rs. 45,000/- as ad interim victim compensation to the informant without prejudice to their defence in this case and undertake to cooperate with the investigation of the case. Hence, it is submitted that the petitioners be given the privilege of anticipatory bail. 
 Learned Addl. P.P. opposes the prayer for grant of anticipatory bail. 
 Considering the submissions of the counsels and the fact as discussed above, I am of the opinion that it is a fit case where the above named petitioners be given the privilege of anticipatory bail. Hence, in the event of their arrest or surrender within a period of six weeks from the date of this order, they shall be released on bail on jointly depositing a demand draft of Rs. 45,000/- as ad interim victim compensation in favour of informant and on furnishing bail bond of Rs. 25,000/- (Rupees Twenty Five Thousand) each with two sureties of the like amount each to the satisfaction of learned J.M., Giridih, in connection with Dhanwar P.S. Case No.61 of 2019 with the condition that the petitioners will cooperate with the investigation of the case and appear before the Investigating Officer as and when noticed by him and will furnish their mobile numbers and a copy of their Aadhar Cards in the court below with the undertaking that they will not change their mobile numbers during the pendency of the case subject to the conditions laid down under section 438 (2) Cr. P.C. 
 In case, the petitioners deposits the ad interim victim compensation amount, the court below is directed to issue notice to the informant and hand over the said demand draft to him, after proper identification. 
 (Anil Kumar Choudhary, J.) Sonu/Gunjan-

case title: Priyanka Sinha vs The State Of Jharkhand
judges name(s): (Anil Kumar Choudhary, J.), (Rupees Twenty Five thousand), (2)
issues: ['Section 354 in The Indian Penal Code', 'Section 406 in The Indian Penal Code', 'Section 420 in The Indian Penal Code']
all_text:
CORAM: HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE ANIL KUMAR CHOUDHARY 
 ------ 
 For the Petitioner : Mr. Sanjeev Kumar, Advocate For the State : Mr. S.K. Srivastava, Addl. P.P. 
 ------ 
 Order No.02 Dated- 16.09.2020 Heard the parties through video conferencing. Learned counsel for the petitioner personally undertakes to remove the defects as pointed out by the stamp reporter within two weeks after the lockdown period is over. 
 In view of the personal undertaking of the learned counsel for the petitioner, the defects pointed out by the stamp reporter are ignored for the present. 
 Apprehending her arrest, the petitioner has moved this Court for grant of privilege of anticipatory bail in connection with Sadar P.S. Case No.345 of 2019 registered undersections 420/406of the Indian Penal Code. 
 The Learned counsel for the petitioner submits that the petitioner who was working as staff in the firm 'Advance Marketing' and was entrusted with the responsibility of maintaining cash book of sell, deposit money in the bank, has misappropriated a sum of Rs.14,03,402/-. It is further submitted that the allegation against the petitioner are all false and only to put pressure as the petitioner as she has filed complaint being Complaint Case No.3462 of 2019 for the offence punishable underSection 354and120Bof I.P.C. in the court of C.J.M., Ranchi, before this case; this false case has been foisted against her. Hence, it is submitted that the petitioner be given the privilege of anticipatory bail. 
 The learned counsel for the petitioner seeks permission of this Court to implead informant as opposite party no.2 of this anticipatory bail application. 
 The petitioner is directed to incorporate the name of informant as opposite party no.2 of this anticipatory bail application, within a week after the lockdown period is over. 
 Let notice be issued to the newly impleaded opposite party no.2 under registered cover with A/D as well as under ordinary process for which requisites etc. must be filed within two weeks by the petitioner, failing which, this application shall stand dismissed without further reference to the Bench. 
 The learned Addl. P.P. opposes the prayer for anticipatory bail. 
 List this case on 09.11.2020. 
 Considering the submissions of the counsels and the fact as discussed above, I am inclined to pass an interim order of anticipatory bail provisionally till 09.11.2020. In case of the petitioner being arrested by the police on or before 09.11.2020, she shall be released on bail provisionally on furnishing bail bond of Rs. 25,000/- (Rupees Twenty Five thousand) with two sureties of like amount each to the satisfaction of the officer concerned in connection with Sadar P.S. Case No.345 of 2019 subject to the conditions laid down underSection 438(2)of the Code of Criminal Procedure. 
 (Anil Kumar Choudhary, J.) Sonu/Gunjan-

case title: Dharamvir Oraon vs The State Of Jharkhand
judges name(s): (Anil Kumar Choudhary, J.), (Rupees Twenty Five Thousand), (2)
issues: ['Section 313 in The Indian Penal Code', 'Section 376 in The Indian Penal Code']
all_text:
CORAM: HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE ANIL KUMAR CHOUDHARY 
 ------ 
 Heard the parties through video conferencing. Learned counsel for the petitioner personally undertakes to remove the defects as pointed out by the stamp reporter within two weeks after the lockdown period is over. 
 In view of the personal undertaking of the learned counsel for the petitioner, the defects pointed out by the stamp reporter are ignored for the present. 
 Apprehending his arrest, the petitioner has moved this Court for grant of privilege of anticipatory bail in connection with Puso P.S. Case No.11 of 2020 registered undersections 376/313of the Indian Penal Code. 
 The Learned counsel for the petitioner submits that the allegation against the petitioner is that the petitioner established sexual relationship with a promise of marriage but after getting the employment he is not willing to marry the victim. It is further submitted that the allegation against the petitioner are all false. It iis then submitted that after the negotiation of the marriage between the petitioner and the victim, while returning from the house of the victim, the petitioner came to know that the informant is in relationship with one Satish Oraon who resides in the same village from 2014 and they live like husband and wife and upon enquiry by the petitioner's family, the same was confirmed as a result of which, the said negotiation of marriage failed. Hence, the informant has instituted this false case to harass the petitioner who is a constable in Jharkhand Jaguar Police. It is then submitted that the petitioner is ready and willing to pay Rs. 2,00,000/- as ad interim victim compensation to the informant without prejudice to his defence in this case and subject to final decision of the case and undertakes to cooperate with the investigation of the case. Hence, it is submitted that the petitioner be given the privilege of anticipatory bail. 
 Learned Addl. P.P. opposes the prayer for grant of anticipatory bail. 
 Considering the submissions of the counsels and the fact as discussed above, I am of the opinion that it is a fit case where the above named petitioner be given the privilege of anticipatory bail. Hence, in the event of his arrest or surrender within a period of four months from the date of this order, he shall be released on bail on depositing a demand draft of Rs. 2,00,000/- as ad interim victim compensation subject to final decision of the case in favour of informant and on furnishing bail bond of Rs. 25,000/- (Rupees Twenty Five Thousand) with two sureties of the like amount each to the satisfaction of learned C.J.M., Gumla, in connection with Puso P.S. Case No.11 of 2020 with the condition that the petitioner will cooperate with the investigation of the case and appear before the Investigating Officer as and when noticed by him and will furnish his mobile number and a copy of his Aadhar Card in the court below with the undertaking that he will not change his mobile number during the pendency of the case subject to the conditions laid down under section 438 (2) Cr. P.C. 
 In case, the petitioner deposits the ad interim victim compensation amount, the court below is directed to issue notice to the informant and hand over the said demand draft to her, after proper identification. 
 (Anil Kumar Choudhary, J.) Sonu/Gunjan-

all_text:
1. Ganesh Das 
 2. Shyam Kumar Pandit. 
 ... ... Petitioners 
 -V e r s u s - 
 1. The State of Jharkhand ... ... Opposite Party CORAM: - HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE DR. S. N. PATHAK (Through: Video Conferencing) For the Petitioners : Mr. Rohan Mazumdar, Advocate. 
 Mr. Vikram Singh, Advocate. 
 through Video Conferencing. Concerned lawyers have no objection with regard to the proceeding, which has been held through Video Conferencing today at 10:30 A.M. onwards. They have no complaint in respect to the audio and video clarity and quality. 
 Apprehending their arrest, petitioners have filed the instant application for grant of anticipatory bail in connection with Loyabad P.S. Case No. 47 of 2019, for the offence underSection 392IPC. 
 Mr. Rohan Mazumdar, learned counsel appearing for the petitioners submits that petitioners are innocent and have not committed any offence as alleged in the FIR, rather, they have been falsely implicated in the present case. From perusal of the FIR it appears that accused Niranjan Yadav had stanched the cell phone of the informant but the name of the petitioners are not mentioned in the FIR and no prima facie case underSection 392of IPC is made out against the petitioners. Learned counsel further argues that there is delay of three days in lodging the FIR since the occurrence took place on 03.08.2019 but the FIR was lodged on 06.08.2019. Learned counsel further argues that the petitioners and the respondents have settled their dispute and good relationship has been restored between them and the informant does not want to proceed further any proceeding against the petitioners. 
 Mr. Anjani Kumar Toppo, learned APP vehemently opposes the contention of the petitioners. 
 In the facts and circumstances, since the informant and petitioners have settled their disputes amicably, I am inclined to enlarge the petitioners on bail. 
 Hence, in the event of arrest by the police or surrender before the Court below within a period of four weeks from today, the petitioners named above shall be enlarged on bail on furnishing bail bonds of Rs.20,000/- (Rupees Twenty Thousand) each, with two sureties of the like amount each, to the satisfaction of learned Judicial Magistrate, 1st Class, Dhanbad, in connection with Loyabad P.S. Case No. 47 of 2019, subject to fulfillment of the condition as laid down under Section 438 (2) Cr.P.C. 
 (Dr. S. N. Pathak, J. ) kunal

case title: Ashok Mandal vs The State Of Jharkhand
judges name(s): (Anil Kumar Choudhary, J.), (Rupees Twenty Five Thousand), (G.R. No. 38 of 2020), (2)
issues: ['Section 34 in The Indian Penal Code', 'Section 506 in The Indian Penal Code', 'Section 379 in The Indian Penal Code', 'Section 354 in The Indian Penal Code', 'Section 323 in The Indian Penal Code']
all_text:
1. Ashok Mandal 
 2. Pramod Kumar Mandal ... Petitioners Versus The State of Jharkhand ... Opposite Party 
 ------ 
 CORAM: HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE ANIL KUMAR CHOUDHARY 
 ------ 
 Heard the parties through video conferencing. Learned counsel for the petitioners personally undertakes to remove the defects as pointed out by the stamp reporter within two weeks after the lockdown period is over. 
 In view of the personal undertaking of the learned counsel for the petitioners, the defects pointed out by the stamp reporter are ignored for the present. 
 Apprehending their arrest, the petitioners have moved this Court for grant of privilege of anticipatory bail in connection with Rajmahal P.S. Case No.06 of 2020 (G.R. No. 38 of 2020) registered undersections 448/323/354/379/506/34of the Indian Penal Code. 
 The Learned counsel for the petitioners submits that the allegation against the petitioners is that the petitioners in furtherance of common intention trespassed into the house of the informant and outraged the modesty of the informant and trashed her on the ground at the point of knife and committed theft of silver chain. It is further submitted that the allegation against the petitioners are all false and for the selfsame occurrence, from the side of the petitioners, the mother of the petitioners has lodged an FIR basing upon which Rajmahal P.S. Case No.08 of 2020 (G.R. No. 44 of 2020) has been registered. It is next submitted that there was free fight between the parties. It is then submitted that the petitioners are ready and willing to jointly pay Rs. 20,000/- as ad interim victim compensation to the informant without prejudice to their defence in this case and undertake to cooperate with the investigation of the case. Hence, it is submitted that the petitioners be given the privilege of anticipatory bail. 
 Learned Addl. P.P. opposes the prayer for grant of anticipatory bail. 
 Considering the submissions of the counsels and the fact as discussed above, I am of the opinion that it is a fit case where the above named petitioners be given the privilege of anticipatory bail. Hence, in the event of their arrest or surrender within a period of six weeks from the date of this order, they shall be released on bail on jointly depositing a demand draft of Rs. 20,000/- as ad interim victim compensation in favour of informant and on furnishing bail bond of Rs. 25,000/- (Rupees Twenty Five Thousand) each with two sureties of the like amount each to the satisfaction of learned S.D.J.M., Rajmahal, in connection with Rajmahal P.S. Case No.06 of 2020 (G.R. No. 38 of 2020) with the condition that the petitioners will cooperate with the investigation of the case and appear before the Investigating Officer as and when noticed by him and will furnish their mobile numbers and a copy of their Aadhar Cards in the court below with the undertaking that they will not change their mobile numbers during the pendency of the case subject to the conditions laid down under section 438 (2) Cr. P.C. 
 In case, the petitioners deposits the ad interim victim compensation amount, the court below is directed to issue notice to the informant and hand over the said demand draft to her, after proper identification. 
 (Anil Kumar Choudhary, J.) Sonu/Gunjan-

 For the Petitioner : Mr. Manoj Kr. Choubey, Advocate For the State : Mr. S.K. Dubey, Addl. P.P.

 Order No.02 Dated- 16.09.2020 Heard the parties through video conferencing. Learned counsel for the petitioner personally undertakes to remove the defects as pointed out by the stamp reporter within two weeks after the lockdown period is over. 
 In view of the personal undertaking of the learned counsel for the petitioner, the defects pointed out by the stamp reporter are ignored for the present. 
 Apprehending his arrest, the petitioner has moved this Court for grant of privilege of anticipatory bail in connection with Garhwa P.S. Case No.148 of 2018 (G.R. No. 773 of 2018) registered undersections 406/420of the Indian Penal Code. 
 Let notice be issued to the opposite party no.2 under registered cover with A/D as well as under ordinary process for which requisites etc. must be filed within two weeks by the petitioner, failing which, this application shall stand dismissed without further reference to the Bench. 
 Learned counsel for the petitioner submits that the allegation against the petitioner is that the informant supplied 1020 sacks of cement to the petitioner worth Rs.3,65,568/- but did not pay the said amount and lastly issued a cheque of Rs.1,37,000/- in part payment of the said amount but the said cheque was dishonoured due to insufficient balance in the account. It is next submitted that the allegation against the petitioner are false and the informant did not supply the cement and the said cheque of Rs.1,37,000/- was given by the petitioner as security but the same has been misused by the informant to make out a false case. Hence, it is submitted that the petitioner be given the privilege of anticipatory bail. 
 The learned Addl. P.P. opposes the prayer for anticipatory bail. 
 List this case on 09.11.2020. 
 Considering the submissions of the counsels and the fact as discussed above, I am inclined to pass an interim order of anticipatory bail provisionally till 09.11.2020. In case of the petitioner being arrested by the police on or before 09.11.2020, he shall be released on bail provisionally on furnishing bail bond of Rs. 25,000/- (Rupees Twenty Five thousand) with two sureties of like amount each to the satisfaction of the officer concerned in connection with Garhwa P.S. case title: Binit Kumar Gupta vs The State Of Jharkhand
issues: ['Section 54 in The Mines Act, 1952', 'Section 379 in The Indian Penal Code', 'Section 506 in The Indian Penal Code', 'Section 504 in The Indian Penal Code']
all_text:
CORAM : HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE RAJESH SHANKAR 
 ------ 
 Learned counsel for the petitioners undertakes to deposit the deficit court fee including other fee/stamp as soon as the present situation prevailing due to outbreak of COVID-19 (Coronavirus) pandemic normalizes. 
 At the request of learned counsel for the petitioners, rest of the defects, as pointed out by the office, are ignored. 
 The petitioners are apprehending their arrest for the offences punishable underSections 147,148,149,336,337,332,333,353,307,504,506,379of the Indian Penal Code andSection 54of the Mines and Minerals (Development andRegulation) Act. 
 Learned counsel for the petitioners submits that the petitioners have been falsely implicated in the present case and have not committed any offence as alleged in the first information report. The petitioner no.1 is the registered owner of the truck bearing registration no.JH18 E 6685 and the petitioner no.2 is the registered owner of the truck bearing registration no. JH18 E 2209. As per the F.I.R., about 50-60 trucks overloaded with stone chips were apprehended by the joint team of the officers of the different departments of Sahebganj district which got escaped after the local people pelted stones over the government officers. It is further submitted that list of the said allegedly escaped trucks appended with the F.I.R. would suggest that the petitioners' trucks which have been mentioned at Serial Nos.194 and 196 were empty. In fact, the entire story regarding escape of the apprehended trucks has been concocted by the authorities. The petitioners have no criminal antecedents against them as has been stated in paragraph 13 of the present anticipatory bail application. Hence, the petitioners may be given the privilege of anticipatory bail. 
 Learned A.P.P. opposed the petitioners' prayer for anticipatory bail. Having heard learned counsel for the parties and considering the facts and circumstances of the case, I am inclined to grant anticipatory bail to the-2-petitioners. Accordingly, the petitioners above named, are directed to surrender before the concerned court below within four weeks from today. In the event of their arrest/surrender before the concerned court below within the aforesaid period, they shall be released on bail on furnishing bail bond of Rs.20,000/-(Rupees Twenty Thousand) each with two sureties of the like amount each to the satisfaction of the court of learned Sub- Divisional Judicial Magistrate, Sahebganj in connection with Mirzachouki P.S. Case No.18 of 2017 corresponding to G.R. No.150 of 2017, subject to the conditions as laid down under Section 438(2) Cr.P.C. 
 (Rajesh Shankar, J.) Rohit

CORAM : HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE RAJESH SHANKAR 
 ------ 
 At the request of learned counsel for the petitioner the defects, as pointed out by the office, are ignored. 
 The petitioner is apprehending his arrest for the offence punishable underSections 323/504/386/354-Bof the Indian Penal Code. 
 Learned counsel for the petitioner submits that the petitioner has been falsely implicated in the present case and has not committed any offence as alleged in the complaint leading to lodging of the F.I.R. underSection 156(3)of the Cr.P.C. It is further submitted that in fact the father-in- law of the petitioner is the registered owner of the land in question. However, the informant was making construction over the said land only after making payment of token amount which was objected by the petitioner and his family members. Due to the said reason, a complaint petition was filed in pursuance of which the F.I.R. was lodged underSection 156(3)of the Cr.P.C. Admittedly, no injury has been caused to the informant in the alleged occurrence. Hence, the petitioner may be given the privilege of anticipatory bail. 
 Learned A.P.P. opposed the petitioner's prayer for anticipatory bail. Having heard learned counsel for the parties and considering the facts and circumstances of the case, I am inclined to grant anticipatory bail to the petitioner. Accordingly, the petitioner above named, is directed to surrender before the concerned court below within four weeks from today. In the event of his arrest/surrender before the concerned court below within the aforesaid period, he shall be released on bail on furnishing bail bond of Rs.20,000/-(Rupees Twenty Thousand) with two sureties of the like amount each to the satisfaction of the court of learned Judicial Magistrate 1st Class, Deoghar in connection with Kunda P.S. case title: Chhutu Kumar Gope @ Chhutu Gope vs The State Of Jharkhand
issues: ['Section 34 in The Indian Penal Code', 'Section 414 in The Indian Penal Code']
all_text:
Chhutu Kumar Gope @ Chhutu Gope 
 2. Dhaneshwar Gope ...Petitioners 
 -V e r s u s- 
 The State of Jharkhand ... Opp. Party CORAM: - HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE RAJESH SHANKAR For the Petitioners :- Mr. Mukesh Kumar, Advocate For the State :- Mr. Shekhar Sinha, A.P.P. 
 02/16.09.2020 The present case is taken up through video conferencing. 
 Considering the present situation prevailing due to outbreak of COVID-19 (Coronavirus) pandemic, at the request of the learned counsel for the petitioners, the defect, as pointed out by the office, is ignored. 
 Heard learned counsel for the parties. 
 The petitioners apprehending their arrest in connection with Chas (M) P.S. Case No. 31 of 2020 registered underSections 414/34of the Indian Penal Code, have prayed for grant of anticipatory bail. 
 Learned counsel for the petitioners submits that the petitioners have been falsely implicated in the present case and have not committed any offence as alleged in the F.I.R. On perusal of the F.I.R., it would be evident that the petitioners along with co-accused Vijay Kumar were arrested by the police at the spot on 19.05.2020 itself, however surprisingly they were neither produced before the court nor any explanation was given in that regard. In fact, the recovery of the coal was made from a common place in the village and the motorcycles of the accused persons lying in front of their houses were seized. The entire allegation made by the informant in the written report is false and concocted. Hence, the petitioners may be given the privilege of anticipatory bail. 
 Learned A.P.P. opposes the petitioners' prayer for anticipatory bail. Considering the aforesaid facts and circumstance, I am inclined to enlarge the petitioners on anticipatory bail. Accordingly, the petitioners, above named, are directed to surrender before the concerned court below within four weeks from today. In the event of their arrest/surrender before the concerned court below within the aforesaid period, they shall be released on bail on furnishing bail bond of Rs.20,000/- (twenty thousand only) each with two sureties of the like amount each to the satisfaction of the Judicial Magistrate-1st Class, Bokaro in connection with Chas(M) P.S. Case No. 31 of 2020, subject to the conditions as laid down under Section 438(2) of Cr.P.C.

case title: Moin Ansari vs The State Of Jharkhand
issues: ['Section 506 in The Indian Penal Code', 'Section 34 in The Indian Penal Code', 'Section 323 in The Indian Penal Code', 'Section 341 in The Indian Penal Code', 'Section 406 in The Indian Penal Code']
all_text:
The present case is taken up through video conferencing. 
 In view of the undertaking given by the learned counsel for the petitioner, the defect regarding payment of Court fee as well as other defects, as pointed out by the office, are ignored. 
 Heard learned counsel for the parties. 
 The petitioner apprehending his arrest in connection with Kanke P.S. Case No. 80 of 2020 registered underSections 420/406/341/323/34/506of the Indian Penal Code, has prayed for grant of anticipatory bail. 
 Learned counsel for the petitioner submits that the petitioner has been falsely implicated in the present case and has not committed any offence as alleged in the F.I.R. It has been alleged against the accused persons including the petitioner that they had taken JCB machine bearing registration no. JH02AK-1285 from the informant on rent, however the accused persons paid Rs.85,000/- only against the due amount of rent payable to him. It has also been alleged in the F.I.R. that the said J.C.B. machine was made to disappear by the accused persons. Learned counsel for the petitioner while referring the paragraph-8 of the present anticipatory bail application submits that on 11.05.2020, the informant along with police came to the petitioner's house and forcibly took away the said JCB machine. Even if the entire allegation made in the written report of the informant is taken to be true, it is the matter of civil dispute. Hence, the petitioner may be given the privilege of anticipatory bail. 
 Learned A.P.P. opposes the petitioner's prayer for anticipatory bail. 
 Considering the aforesaid facts and circumstance, I am inclined to enlarge the petitioner on anticipatory bail. Accordingly, the petitioner, above named, is directed to surrender before the concerned court below within four weeks from today. In the event of his arrest/surrender before the concerned court below within the aforesaid period, he shall be released on bail on furnishing bail bond of Rs.20,000/- (twenty thousand only) with two sureties of the like amount each to the satisfaction of the Chief Judicial Magistrate, Ranchi in connection with Kanke P.S. Case No. 80 of 2020, subject to the conditions as laid down under Section 438(2) of Cr.P.C. 
 (Rajesh Shankar, J.) Ritesh/

case title: Najme Alam @ Gama vs The State Of Jharkhand

issues: ['Section 34 in The Indian Penal Code', 'Section 506 in The Indian Penal Code', 'Section 504 in The Indian Penal Code', 'Section 379 in The Indian Penal Code', 'Section 354 in The Indian Penal Code']
all_text:
1. Najme Alam @ Gama 
 2. Alamgir Sk. 
 3. Kamal Sk. 
 4. Ansal Sk. 
 5. Ahad Sk. @ Abdul Ahad 6 Ajhar Sk. @ Md. Ajhruddin Sk. 
 ... ... Petitioners 
 -V e r s u s - 
 1. The State of Jharkhand ... ... Opposite Party CORAM: - HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE DR. S. N. PATHAK (Through: Video Conferencing) For the Petitioners : Mr. Sandip Kumar Burnwal, Advocate. 
 through Video Conferencing. Concerned lawyers have no objection with regard to the proceeding, which has been held through Video Conferencing today at 10:30 A.M. onwards. They have no complaint in respect to the audio and video clarity and quality. 
 Apprehending their arrest, petitioners have filed the instant application for grant of anticipatory bail in connection with Kotalpokhar P.S. Case No. 29 of 2020, for the offence underSections 341/323/354/379/504/506/34IPC. 
 Mr. Sandip Kumar Burnwal, learned counsel appearing for the petitioners submits that petitioners are innocent and have not committed any offence as alleged in the FIR and they have been falsely implicated in the instant case. Learned counsel further argues that there is no specific allegation against the petitioners and all the allegations are omnibus. Learned counsel further argues that only because of the land dispute, the petitioners were dragged in the instant case. It is a case of civil dispute and criminality has not been attracted. 
 Mr. Shailesh Kumar Sinha, learned APP vehemently opposes the contention of the petitioners and submits that allegations against the petitioners is of forming unlawful assembly and assaulting the informant's wife and as such, the petitioners are not entitled for the privilege of anticipatory bail. 
 In the facts and circumstances, it appears that it is a case if civil dispute and no criminality is attracted against the petitioners and as such, I am inclined to enlarge the petitioners on bail. 
 Hence, in the event of arrest by the police or surrender before the Court below within a period of four weeks from today, the petitioners named above shall be enlarged on bail on furnishing bail bonds of Rs.20,000/- (Rupees Twenty Thousand) each, with two sureties of the like amount each, to the satisfaction of learned Additional Chief Judicial Magistrate, Rajmahal, in connection with Kotalpokhar P.S. Case No. 29 of 2020, subject to fulfillment of the condition as laid down under Section 438 (2) Cr.P.C. 
 (Dr. S. N. Pathak, J. ) kunal

For the State : Mr. P.K. Chatterjee @ Prabir Chatterjee, APP 02/16.09.2020 In view of outbreak of COVID-19 pandemic, case has been taken up through Video Conferencing. Concerned lawyers have no objection with regard to the proceeding, which has been held through Video Conferencing today at 10:30 A.M. onwards. They have no complaint in respect to the audio and video clarity and quality. 
 Apprehending their arrest, petitioners have filed the instant application for grant of anticipatory bail in connection with Balumath P.S. Case No. 17 of 2019 for the offence underSection 295-AIPC andSection 12(ii) Jharkhand Bovine Animal Prohibition of Slaughter Act. 
 Mr. Vijay Shankar Prasad, learned counsel appearing for the petitioners submits that petitioners are innocent and have not committed any offence as alleged in the FIR and they have been falsely implicated in the instant case. Learned counsel further argues that nothing has been recovered from the conscious possession of the petitioners and from perusal of the seizure list it appears that prohibited meat of bovine animal has been recovered from the possession of Bablu Quraishi, Minhaj Quraishi and Bhola Quraishi, who have been granted anticipatory bail by this Court vide order dated 18.04.2019, passed in A.B.A. No. 1817 of 2019. There is no seizure list against the petitioner and hence, the case of the petitioners stand on better footing in comparison to the petitioners of A.B.A. No. 1817 of 2019. 
 Mr. P.K. Chatterjee, learned APP vehemently opposes the contention of the petitioners. 
 In the facts and circumstances, since the co-accused have already been granted anticipatory bail by this Court vide order dated 18.04.2019, passed in A.B.A. No. 1817 of 2019 and the case of the petitioners stand on better footing than that of the co-accused, I am inclined to enlarge the petitioners on bail. 
 Hence, in the event of arrest by the police or surrender before the Court below within a period of four weeks from today, the petitioners named above shall be enlarged on bail on furnishing bail bonds of Rs.20,000/- (Rupees Twenty Thousand) each, with two sureties of the like amount each, to the satisfaction of learned C.J.M., Latehar, in connection with Balumath P.S. Case No. 17 of 2019, subject to fulfillment of the condition as laid down under Section 438 (2) Cr.P.C.

case title: Hemraj Kumar vs The State Of Jharkhand
issues: ['Section 420 in The Indian Penal Code', 'Section 273 in The Indian Penal Code', 'Section 272 in The Indian Penal Code']
all_text:
CORAM: HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE KAILASH PRASAD DEO Through:- Video Conferencing 
 ----- 
 Learned counsel for the petitioner has submitted that though there are defect nos.5(e) and 9(i) to 9(ii) in the bail application as pointed out by the stamp reporter but he has filed an undertaking that he shall remove the defects within 30 days after the physical court starts and prayed for hearing of the anticipatory bail application, as petitioner is apprehending his arrest during pandemic of Covid-19. 
 Considering the same, this Court is inclined to hear the anticipatory bail application on merits, but with condition that petitioner shall remove the defects within 30 days after the physical court starts. Joint Registrar (Judicial) is directed to ensure the compliance of this order after the physical court starts so as to remove the defects. Heard, learned counsel for the petitioner, Mr. Lukesh Kumar and learned counsel for the State, Mr. Vishwanath Roy. 
 Learned counsel for the petitioner has submitted that petitioner is apprehending his arrest in connection with Gorhar P.S. Case No.68 of 2018, for the offence registered underSections 272/273/420IPC and underSection 47(a)of Excise Act. 
 Learned counsel for the petitioner has submitted that the instant FIR has been lodged against seven named accused persons including the petitioner at serial No.2 as police had got secret information and seized 23 cartoons of Royal Stag from the Tata Magic Pick-up van of the petitioner. Learned counsel for the petitioner has further submitted that petitioner has a Tata Magic Pick-up van bearing registration No.JH05BJ-8959, as such, he has been made accused though he has executed an agreement with Monu Mishra for 11 months vide agreement dated 02.08.2018, which was applicable-2-from 24.07.2018 on monthly rent of Rs.21,000/-. 
 Learned counsel for the petitioner has further submitted that Monu Mishra was not paying the rent per month, as such, he made a complaint before the Jugsalai Police Station vide Sanha Entry dated 18.02.2020 and the petitioner has no criminal antecedent, as such, he may be enlarged on anticipatory bail. Learned counsel for the State has opposed the prayer for anticipatory bail and has submitted that petitioner is the owner of the said vehicle and he cannot shift his liability on the basis of unregistered document. Sanha has been made deliberately before the Jugsalai Police Station on 18.02.2020 whereas an FIR has been lodged on 05.10.2018 in the District of Hazaribagh. Learned counsel for the State has further submitted that driver, Deepak Sahu has been enlarged on regular bail, as such, petitioner does not deserve to be enlarged on anticipatory bail on such frivolous plea. After some argument, learned counsel for the petitioner seeks permission to withdraw this application. 
 Permission is granted. 
 Learned counsel for the State has no objection. 
 Accordingly, the instant anticipatory bail application is dismissed as withdrawn. 
 (Kailash Prasad Deo, J.) sandeep/R.S.-

case title: Md. Majlum Hussain vs The State Of Jharkhand
judges name(s): (Anil Kumar Choudhary, J.), (Rupees Twenty Five Thousand), (2)
issues: ['Section 420 in The Indian Penal Code', 'Section 34 in The Indian Penal Code', 'Section 471 in The Indian Penal Code', 'Section 468 in The Indian Penal Code', 'Section 467 in The Indian Penal Code']
all_text:
1. Md. Majlum Hussain 
 2. Abdul Kudus ... Petitioners Versus The State of Jharkhand ... Opposite Party 
 ------ 
 CORAM: HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE ANIL KUMAR CHOUDHARY 
 ------ 
 For the Petitioners : Mr. Sujit Kr. Singh, Advocate For the State : Mr. Shailesh Kr. Sinha, Addl. P.P. 
 ------ 
 Order No.02 Dated- 16.09.2020 Heard the parties through video conferencing. Learned counsel for the petitioners personally undertakes to remove the defects as pointed out by the stamp reporter within two weeks after the lockdown period is over. 
 In view of the personal undertaking of the learned counsel for the petitioners, the defects pointed out by the stamp reporter are ignored for the present. 
 Apprehending their arrest, the petitioners have moved this Court for grant of privilege of anticipatory bail in connection with Complaint Case No.35 of 2018 registered undersections 467/468/471/420/34of the Indian Penal Code whereby cognizance has been taken undersection 420of the Indian Penal Code. 
 The Learned counsel for the petitioners submits that the allegation against the petitioners is that the petitioners have gifted land of the complainant to the Governor, State of Jharkhand for construction of a pond. It is, further, submitted that the allegation against the petitioners are all false and the land belongs to the ancestor of the petitioners and in this respect, the learned counsel for the petitioners draws attention of this Court to annexure-3 series. It is next submitted that the petitioners are not enjoying that land and the complainant has no right, title or interest over the said land and only to harass the petitioners who are the public spirit citizens, this false case has been foisted. It is then submitted that the dispute between the parties is basically a civil dispute. Hence, it is submitted that the petitioners be given the privilege of anticipatory bail. 
 Learned Addl. P.P. opposes the prayer for grant of anticipatory bail. 
 Considering the submissions of the counsels and the fact as discussed above, I am of the opinion that it is a fit case where the above named petitioners be given the privilege of anticipatory bail. Hence, in the event of their arrest or surrender within a period of six weeks from the date of this order, they shall be released on bail on furnishing bail bond of Rs. 25,000/- (Rupees Twenty Five Thousand) each with two sureties of the like amount each to the satisfaction of learned Judicial Magistrate -1st Class, Giridih, in connection with Complaint Case No.35 of 2018 subject to the conditions laid down under section 438 (2) Cr. P.C. 
 (Anil Kumar Choudhary, J.) Sonu/Gunjan-

case title: Arun Kumar Burnwal vs The State Of Jharkhand
issues: ['Section 354 in The Indian Penal Code', 'Section 509 in The Indian Penal Code', 'Section 506 in The Indian Penal Code', 'Section 504 in The Indian Penal Code', 'Section 353 in The Indian Penal Code']
all_text:
Arun Kumar Burnwal 
 2. Munna Khatik 
 3. Lalan Khatik 
 4. Sujit Srivastava ...Petitioners 
 -V e r s u s- 
 The State of Jharkhand ... Opp. Party CORAM: - HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE RAJESH SHANKAR For the Petitioners :- Mr. Tarun Kumar No.1, Advocate For the State :- Mr. Bhola Nath Ojha, A.P.P. 
 02/16.09.2020 The present case is taken up through video conferencing. 
 Learned counsel for the petitioners undertakes to deposit the required court fee including other fee/stamp as soon as the present situation prevailing due to outbreak of COVID-19 (Coronavirus) pandemic normalises. 
 At the request of the learned counsel for the petitioner, rest of the defects, as pointed out by the office, are ignored. 
 Heard learned counsel for the parties. 
 The petitioners apprehending their arrest in connection with Giridih (M) P.S. Case No. 76 of 2018 corresponding to G.R. No. 619 of 2018 registered underSections 147/148/149/341/323/337/427/295(A)/353/504/506/509/354of the Indian Penal Code, have prayed for grant of anticipatory bail. 
 Learned counsel for the petitioners submits that the petitioners have been falsely implicated in the present case and have not committed any offence as alleged in the F.I.R. It is alleged that more than 500 persons belonging to two different communities raised slogans against each other and disturbed the communal harmony in the area. They also pelted stones and damaged few vehicles standing there. It is further submitted that except the hearsay statements, the police has not yet collected any cogent evidence against the petitioners to connect them with the alleged offence despite lapse of more than two years from the date of lodging of the F.I.R. Hence, the petitioners may be given the privilege of anticipatory bail. 
 Learned A.P.P. opposes the petitioners' prayer for anticipatory bail Considering the aforesaid facts and circumstance, I am inclined to enlarge the petitioners on anticipatory bail. Accordingly, the petitioners, above named, are directed to surrender before the concerned court below within four weeks from today. In the event of their arrest/surrender before the concerned court below within the aforesaid period, they shall be released on bail on furnishing bail bond of Rs.20,000/- (twenty thousand only) each with two sureties of the like amount each to the satisfaction of the S.D.J.M., Giridih in connection with Giridih (M) P.S. Case No. 76 of 2018 corresponding to G.R. No. 619 of 2018, subject to the conditions as laid down under Section 438(2) of Cr.P.C. 
 (Rajesh Shankar, J.) Ritesh/

all_text:
The present case is taken up through video conferencing. 
 At the request of the learned counsel for the petitioner, the defect, as pointed out by the office, is ignored. 
 Heard learned counsel for the parties. 
 The petitioner apprehending his arrest in connection with Chainpur P.S. Case No. 42 of 2020 registered underSection 414/34of the Indian Penal Code, Section 21(4) of M.M.(D.R.) Act, 1957, Rule 54 of JMMC Rules, 2004 and Sections 9(1), 13 of the Jharkhand Minerals (Prevention of Illegal Mining, Transportation and Storage) Rules, 2007, has prayed for grant of anticipatory bail. 
 Learned counsel for the petitioner submits that the petitioner has been falsely implicated in the present case and has not committed any offence as alleged in the F.I.R. The petitioner is the owner-cum-driver of the seized tractor along with trailer bearing Engine no.-E-3127410, Chasis no.- B-115387. It is further submitted that in fact the seizure of the vehicle has not been made at the spot, rather the said vehicle has been seized from the house of the petitioner. It is also submitted that there is no criminal antecedent against the petitioner and the said statement has been made in paragraph-9 of the present anticipatory bail application. Hence, the petitioner may be given the privilege of anticipatory bail. 
 Learned Spl.P.P. opposes the petitioner's prayer for anticipatory bail. Considering the aforesaid facts and circumstance, I am inclined to enlarge the petitioner on anticipatory bail. Accordingly, the petitioner, above named, is directed to surrender before the concerned court below within four weeks from today. 
 In the event of his arrest/surrender before the concerned court below within the aforesaid period, he shall be released on bail on furnishing bail bond of Rs.20,000/- (twenty thousand only) with two sureties of the like amount each to the satisfaction of the S.D.J.M., Palamau at Daltonganj in connection with Chainpur P.S. Case No. 42 of 2020, subject to the conditions as laid down underSection 438(2)of Cr.P.C.
